# Introduction

This report analyzes selected indicators from the World Development Indicators dataset for 2022. The goal is to explore relationships between economic and development variables.

# Load Data

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("wdi.csv")
df.head()
```

# Exploratory Data Analysis

## Summary Statistics

```{python}
cols = ["gdp_per_capita", "life_expectancy", "total_population"]
summary = df[cols].describe()
summary
```

Table @tbl-summary shows summary statistics of GDP per capita, life expectancy, and population.

```{python}
#| label: tbl-summary
#| tbl-cap: "Summary statistics of selected development indicators"
summary
```

## GDP per Capita vs Life Expectancy

Figure @fig-scatter shows the relationship between GDP per capita and life expectancy.

```{python}
#| label: fig-scatter
#| fig-cap: "Relationship between GDP per capita and life expectancy"

plt.figure()
plt.scatter(df["gdp_per_capita"], df["life_expectancy"])
plt.xlabel("GDP per capita (USD)")
plt.ylabel("Life expectancy (years)")
plt.title("GDP per capita vs Life Expectancy")
plt.show()
```

## Top 10 Countries by Population

Figure @fig-bar shows the countries with the largest populations.

```{python}
#| label: fig-bar
#| fig-cap: "Top 10 countries by total population"

top10 = df.sort_values("total_population", ascending=False).head(10)

plt.figure()
plt.bar(top10["country"], top10["total_population"])
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.xlabel("Country")
plt.ylabel("Population")
plt.title("Top 10 Countries by Population")
plt.show()
```
